data.title: A disappointment
data.text:
Sushi falls apart, the katsu for the little one took a long time and when we got it it was cold... that would probably be because the waitress was busy drinking with one of the other tables, while shouting and making the experience even more noisy and unpleasant... that's probably why she also forgot our wasabi too - so I got up and asked the chefs for it...
Prices are reasonable, but don't try the combo - they are overpriced and defenitly not worth it...
The place is small and looks nice, but we had the misfortune of sitting there while there was a loud bunch drinking and shouting (including our waitress..), so even our kids said that it was too loud...

data.title: Second visit so-so
data.text: Was happier after my first visit. Won't be returning a third time. Chef said that "quality daikon was not available" at their store at this time, hence that was the reason they didn't have it for the tempura dipping sauce. Huh? There are many grocery stores around that have daikon now, it's not out of season. Also the honey walnut shrimp sushi roll tasted weird, I think because the walnuts were over-toasted and didn't taste like walnuts anymore. I know, that is not traditional Japanese sushi. I was expecting something that tastes like the honey walnut prawns entree in nearby Chinese restaurants (which I don't think is a traditional Chinese dish either).

data.title: first time for Sushi
data.text: It was a good experience. We tried 3-4 different items. The honey walnut(?) shrimp roll was awesome!

data.title: Good things come in small bites
data.text: They do a great job with their sushi, with a great happy hour. They accommodated our large party gracefully (we took up over half their restaurant!)!

data.title: VERY TASTY JAPANESE FOOD MADE BY CHINESEIII
data.text: I had the Tonkatsu dinner, It was very tasty with a large portion of the meat. The non traditional buttered vegetables blended in very well with the meal.

data.title: So-so sushi
data.text:
Kamu Sushi is a very small establishment with very limited seating.  We were fortunate to get a table for the 8 of us on a Friday night.
There is quite an array of items on the menu.  Most of the sushi offered are not your typical varieties you get in Japanese restaurants, in fact, I would classify them as experimental.  The rice used in the rolls was a little too wet and the servings were a little small considering the pricing.  Quality of the ingredients were decent but nothing really to shout about.
An average establishment on the whole which I doubt I would return to if I were a local.

data.title: Slice of Tokyo in South San Francisco
data.text: Good; have both the traditional and modern Sushis; fish was very fresh. and certainly hit the spot. This is a nice cozy little resto bar. Reminds me a lot of one of my favorite bars in Tokyo. Definitely coming back for a bite and a drink

data.title: Good sushi
data.text: Was looking for a sushi joint close to our hotel and so pleased we found this place.  Was so good we went back the next night.  Food was good and has a nice atmosphere.  Service was good too.

data.title: HAPPY HOUR EVERY DAY!
data.text:
Discovered Kamu Sushi as we were driving down Grand Avenue in South San Francisco.  Small, but cozy and nicely appointed.  Cool vibe.  The servers know the food and can give you good recommendations.
The Happy Hour is from 5 pm - 6:30 pm every day and their Happy Hour Menu has a good selection of food and beverage items.  
I've been there 3 times in the last two weeks.  Have ordered items off the regular menu (Kamikaze Fireball Roll) and one of their Hand Rolled specials.  Both, very tasty, very inventive, and beautifully presented.  But ... a bit more expensive than other restaurants in the area.
The Happy Hour Menu is reasonably priced, and the items on it are also beautifully presented and inventive.  The sushi chefs take pride in their work.  Everything looks and tastes fresh.
Very fun to go with a few other people and each order an item off the Happy Hour Menu to share with the table.   I've become a fan!
Kamu Sushi is an excellent addition to Grand Avenue!

data.title: Good sushi, better chef
data.text:
Was on a business trip in SSF.  Wanted sushi and didn't want to drive far.  Stopped here, noticed it was full so we sat at the bar.  

Food/Drink
- had one roll and the rest sashimi
- very good
- well prepared
- great sake and many choices

Experience
- the sushi chef was a lot of fun. He was drinking a beer and kept encouraging us to drink sake (must admit we had a lot that night)
- the waitresses provide nice service
- they ran out of yellowtail and compensated us accordingly

data.title: Yuck
data.text:
Went for a late lunch and it was not good.  Had nigiri and a roll.  It was not worth the hefty bill afterward.  I will pay for good food but none of it was any good.  The fish taste stringy and previous frozen.  The roll was cover in some weird mayo sauce.  Would never go back here.

It took 30 mins to get the food as the chefs were too busy preparing food for girls sitting at the bar who were probably not paying customer.

To top it off, none of the chefs were Japanese.  It's a Chinese run business.

data.title: 신선해요
data.text: 우연치않게 숙소 근처에 스시집을 찾다 들어간곳이예요. 그런데 생각보다 생선의 질이 넘 좋았어요. 스시 사시미 다 맛있었어요.  오랜만에 맛있는 스시를 먹는 느낌

data.title: Buen Sushi
data.text: Excelente Sushi y mejor su ubicacion. Pedimos varios rolls y todos estaban muy buenos, lo recomiendo

data.title: multiculturalismo della cucina giapponese
data.text: un piccolo ristorante nei sobborghi di san francisco ... non solo sushi ... ma anche invenzione dell'affumicatura del salmone al profumo di sakè....granchio molle fritto...insalata di alghe...
